I: "Okay, can anyone get the projector to work?"
N: Showing up in ragged cut-offs on the day of the career fair.

B: Successfully persuading a source that NYC News Service exists.
I: External hard drive crashed the week your capstone is due.
N: Lost your laptop somewhere in the newsroom.
O: Actually finding a fork in the kitchen.

B: Spotting Greg David in a hard hat.
I: Faking an interview in Portuguese to intimidate your classmates.
N: Knocking your coffee into someone's laptop.
G: Discovering that you have an actual mailbox on campus.
O: Eating your yogurt with a knife. There are always knives in the kitchen.

I: Has anyone seen a white charger?
N: Getting caught humming the Newsies theme on the train.
G: Getting Ann Marie Awad to explain "Drinks? Drinks? Drinks?"
O: Filming the halal vendor on the corner for a video sequence.

N: Flashing the whole class while trying to plug in your laptop.
O: Finding actual mail in your mailbox.

I: Locking yourself out of your own locker.
N: Going to a meeting just for the pizza.
G: Re-reading a story you already filed, and seeing all kinds of errors.
O: Left your laptop for five minutes and someone spilled coffee on it.

I: Catching your TA shopping for shoes.
G: Recording an entire interview with "record" paused.
O: Printing to the wrong classroom while there's a class in session.

B: Eating free cheese and cookies for "dinner"
I: AudioFiles pie for lunch and dinner.
N: "It will be two weeks until your ID works" for 26 consecutive weeks.
G: Three stories due this week, not one phone in the newsroom.
O: So many equipment fines that you avoid eye contact with Allistair.

I: Tim Harper caught you abusing "from ... to ..."
G: Your name on the equipment room wall of shame.
